user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_get_fdset:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_get_fdset (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
               fd_set *read_fd_set,
               fd_set *write_fd_set,
               fd_set *except_fd_set,
               MHD_socket *max_fd)
{
  return MHD_get_fdset2 (daemon,
                         read_fd_set,
                         write_fd_set,
                         except_fd_set,
                         max_fd,
#ifdef HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE
                         daemon->fdset_size_set_by_app ?
                         ((unsigned int) daemon->fdset_size) :
                         ((unsigned int) _MHD_SYS_DEFAULT_FD_SETSIZE)
#else  /* ! HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE */
                         ((unsigned int) _MHD_SYS_DEFAULT_FD_SETSIZE)
#endif /* ! HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE */
                         );
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
#ifdef HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE
                         daemon->fdset_size_set_by_app ?
                         ((unsigned int) daemon->fdset_size) :
                         ((unsigned int) _MHD_SYS_DEFAULT_FD_SETSIZE)
#else  /* ! HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE */
                         ((unsigned int) _MHD_SYS_DEFAULT_FD_SETSIZE)
#endif /* ! HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE */
explanation: All other code in this function is a straightforward return of a single call to MHD_get_fdset2 and contains no statements following the return (no post-return unreachable statements). The only source of potentially unreachable code here is the preprocessor conditional that selects one of two different expressions at compile time: depending on whether HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE is defined, one branch will be omitted from the translation unit and thus effectively unreachable in that build. Therefore only the entire #ifdef...#endif block (and the two alternative expressions it contains) need investigation for Rule 2.1. No other fragments in the provided function introduce unreachable code.
